meanings.definition: Move sideways in a shy or sneaky manner.
meanings.sent1: The cat sidles up to the mouse, trying to catch it.
meanings.sent2: She sidles past the group of people, hoping not to be noticed.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel sidles over to the bird feeder, hoping for a snack.
meanings.sent4: The shadow sidles along the wall, following her every move.
meanings.sent5: The spy sidles through the crowded room, blending in seamlessly.

meanings.sent1: He sidles closer to the door, trying to hear the conversation inside.
meanings.sent2: The thief sidles along the dark alley, looking for an easy target.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon sidles up to the trash can, ready to make a mess.
meanings.sent4: The fog sidles in, enveloping the town in a mysterious haze.
meanings.sent5: The snake sidles through the grass, hunting for its next meal.

meanings.sent1: The crab sidles across the sandy beach, searching for a hiding spot.
meanings.sent2: She sidles to the side to make room for her friend on the bench.
meanings.sent3: The penguin sidles on the ice, slipping and sliding comically.
meanings.sent4: The car sidles into the tight parking spot with precision.
meanings.sent5: The dancer sidles gracefully across the stage, captivating the audience.
